executive_summary: Operators in the industry serve dessert-craving customers a range of treats, including ice cream, doughnuts and cookies. Industry demand has been bolstered over the past five years from the jump in per capita disposable income and per capita dairy consumption. Despite rising inflation and increasing input costs, the industry has still encountered rising demand. However, in 2020, the industry experienced a decline in revenue because of the temporary lockdown measures due to the pandemic. But as lockdown measures were lifted, consumers returned to dessert stores, boosting industry revenue. Over the past five years, revenue has grown at a CAGR of 3.3% to $20.4 billion, including an expected 0.3% decline in 2024. Profit is expected to lag to 4.7% of revenue in 2024 from 4.8% in 2019.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: THE PANDEMIC NEGATIVELY IMPACTED THE INDUSTRY BECAUSE OF TEMPORARY SHUTDOWNS
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In 2020, dessert store revenue plummeted because of the pandemic.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: A DECLINING HEALTHY EATING INDEX LIFTS INDUSTRY DEMAND
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The industry has encountered strong demand through most of the period.
Dessert stores face external competition primarily from grocery stores.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Continuing Decline in the Healthy Eating Index Will Support Industry Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The continuing decline in the healthy-eating index will continue over the five years to 2029.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Dessert Stores Will Expand Product Offerings to Remain Relevant, but Rising Input Costs Will Put Downward Pressure on Profit
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: In order to stay relevant, dessert stores will need to expand their product offerings.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry prepare and/or serve desserts for consumption on or near the premises.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level low - steady

key_trends: Operators compete on the variety of desserts they offer.
The pandemic negatively impacted industry demand in 2020.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Consumers under the age of 25 have less disposable income.
Consumers between the ages of 25 and 34 can enjoy desserts.

products_and_services.product_description: Ice cream and soft serve comprise the industry's largest product segment.

tier_1_suppliers: Ice Cream Production in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Consumer spending measures the total amount spent by Americans.

business_locations.location_description: The West region accounts for 10% of establishments and 20% of the population.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages are a significant expense for dessert stores.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Operators Seek to Offer Various Flavors and Customization
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Dessert shops attempt to cater to a wider audience.

FAQs.question: What offers a personalized experience to the customer?
FAQs.answer: Consumers have the option to customize their desserts.
